title: Serif font with San-serif attributes
content:
Hi all,

Can anyone recommend any san-serif faces that have serif attributes such as tails?

Apologies for the newbie question, I am not exactly sure when a san-serif becomes a serif?

I am trying to create a logo that has a nod towards the traditional aspect of the company, as well as the forward thinkingness of the company.

Appreciate any help to get me on the right track.

Thanks
author: reboot

comments.content:
something with more serif attributes I think, I am still learning, looking through a book I have, they say the classification is slab-serif. I guess I didn't explain too well, wanted something serifs, square serifs.

Now I have found a category for the type of face, should make i easy.

Please post any nice slab-serif faces though.
Wow- Finnegan is a nice suggestion based on the original need. I was thinking Optima, but the need for slab serifs leaves me a bit confused. Is it the fatness and squareness that you want?
There are a bunch of great, contemporary slab-serif suggestions [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018035524/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38605), some from me, some from others.

[Albertus](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018035524/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/albertus/) is a bit of a halfway house, used to great affect by Coldplay in their pre Viva la Vida material and in this Irish sports shop logo.
